report_title: Loan Administration, Check Cashing & Other Services in the US
executive_summary: The Loan Administration, Check Cashing and Other Services industry is highly dependent on the health of the housing market and throughout the current period its continued expansion amid low interest rates and increasing per capita disposable income created demand for industry operators. The servicing operations of the big banks have been increasingly replaced by regional bank servicers as well as nonbanks. Revenue from miscellaneous services within this industry, such as check cashing and money orders, experience competition from online money transfer services.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The Market Has Been Shifting in the Past Five Years
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Nearly all major banks, including Wells Fargo & Company, Bank of America Corporation (BofA), JPMorgan Chase & Co. and Citigroup Inc., have reported year-over-year declines in revenue from loan servicing. Smaller, regional banks and nonbanks' role in the industry increased in the last few years.
New technologies like mobile banking and money transfers systems like PayPal and Venmo make checks irrelevant. Consumers prefer the speed and safety of these new electronic payment systems.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Fees Generated From ATMs and Safe Deposit Box Rentals Are Declining
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: As more banks provide customers with greater ATM availability, there are less fees generated from noncustomers. Fewer customers are using ATMs not affiliated with their banks, leading to less revenue from ATM fees. The decreasing cost of home safes limit revenue from safe deposit box fees. Some banks offer free safe deposit boxes to attract new patrons, also decreasing revenue from this segment.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Industry Demand for Mortgage Loan Servicing Pulls Back as Interest Rates Climb Higher
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: - Runaway inflation has forced the Federal Reserve to aggressively raise interest rates. - Interest rates increases directly affects the 30-year conventional mortgage rate, which has been historically low. - The rate hikes are expected to continue in the outlook period. - Some consumers and businesses will be deterred from making large purchases, primarily home and land expansions in the coming years.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: The Complexity of the Mortgage Lending Business is Expected to Increase
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The continuing evolution of the secondary mortgage market will expand the number of mortgage products available to borrowers.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Increased Regulation Imposed on the Mortgage Industry
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Increased regulation imposed on the mortgage industry will come in the form of higher compliance costs, driving up the need for specialization. Those that can survive these changes in the mortgage lending market are expected to expand over the next five years.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: The Use of Blockchain Networks for Peer-to-Peer Money Transfers Might Bloom
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: There are projects striving to be the future Zelle or PayPal of crypto. Transferring money on a blockchain network could reduce the risk of errors and fraud while increasing the speed. If blockchain technology continues to develop despite the current crypto winter, these new platforms will reduce the need for the industry's money transmission services.

industry_definition: The Loan Administration, Check Cashing and Other Services industry services loans, most notably mortgages. This industry does not originate loans, which includes legally arranging and issuing the loan. Servicing loans includes performing all of the administrative aspects of managing a debt portfolio. Operators also perform money transmission services, which include selling and cashing traveler's checks, money orders and cashier's checks, as well as renting safe-deposit boxes.

opportunities: Demand from real estate loans and collateralized debt

market_segmentation.segment_description: The industry provides servicing for secured and unsecured consumer loans and generates fees for services such as money orders and deposit boxes. The secured consumer market segment primarily deals with residential mortgage loans. Unsecured loans make the lender entirely dependent on the borrower's capacity and willingness to repay the loan.
The other market is composed of a wide range of customers.

Businesses use the industry for cash management and handling services. Businesses purchase document payment instruments, foreign currency exchange services, payment transmission services and loan administration services.

products_and_services.product_description: These services include collecting payments of principal and interest from borrowers; remitting aggregate loan payments to investors; accounting for principal and interest payments; holding escrow funds for payment of mortgage related expenses such as taxes and insurance; making advances to cover delinquent payments; inspecting the mortgaged premises as required; contacting delinquent borrowers; supervising foreclosures and property dispositions in the event of defaults and other miscellaneous duties related to loan administration.
The other product segment includes a variety of fees for bundled deposit account services, safe deposit boxes, ATM charges, document payment products and other electronic transaction fees.
Account reconciliation, cash collection and armored car services, balance reporting and closed cash handling are some of the services included in this segment.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Cash Handling and Management Services Face Competition From New Technologies
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Consumers are increasingly using PayPal, Apple Pay, Venmo or Square Cash instead of traditional money transfer services.

business_locations.location_description: The Southeast has the most industry locations. Loan services tend to follow the spread of the population. Florida has double the number of establishments of any other state in the Southeast since it also has the highest percentage of the population of this region.
The West has the second-most industry locations. California dominates the West region. The large population and expensive real estate prices attract loan brokers.
The Southwest has the third-most industry locations. Texas is the main state for industry operators in the Southwest. Texas booming housing markets makes it ideal for loan service providers.

regulations_points.regulation_description: Mortgage banking businesses are subject to the rules and regulations of various agencies including the Department of Housing & Urban Development (HUD), the Federal Housing Administration (FHA), the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA), Fannie Mae, Freddie Mac (or FHLMC), Ginnie Mae (or GNMA) and other regulatory agencies with respect to originating, processing, underwriting, selling, securitizing and servicing mortgage loans.

The business of mortgage lending and servicing has evolved since the prolonged housing lull that followed the housing crisis of the mid-2000s. When housing prices plunged in 2007, industry participants were unprepared for the refinancing mayhem that soon followed and as a result, many homes were improperly foreclosed upon.

basis_points.basis_description: Local recognition benefits smaller, regionally operated loan servicers.

basis_points.basis_title: The big banks move away from the industry
basis_points.basis_description: The big banks move away from the industry. The increasing absence of these players allows smaller regional banks and local nonbanks to grow their market share.

concentration_points.concentration_title: The big banks decrease focus in the industry
concentration_points.concentration_description: Stricter lending regulations and the loss of mortgage servicing fees from subprime loans decreased revenue for the big banks. The increasing absence of these players allows smaller regional banks and local nonbanks to grow their market share.

Consumers tend to prefer loan servicers knowledgeable of local real estate. This leads to a high number of regional banks and local nonbank servicers specializing in the needs of the community. Local recognition benefits smaller, regionally operated loan servicers.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Wages have increased over the past five years, and are estimated to account for 27.6% of industry revenue in 2023. The need for a lot of skilled workers in loan administration keep wage costs high.

Purchase costs have been stable over the past five years, and are estimated to account for 1.8% of industry revenue in 2023. Purchases consist of professional and technical services, software and other materials.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: Low capital investment relative to labor costs
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: In 2023, for every $1.00 spent on labor, only $0.04 is expected to be spent on capital investment, staying stable since 2018.
The loan servicing segment remains highly labor intensive, as the processing of customer information remains difficult and requires human decision-making.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: Technology replacing labor in cash-handling segments
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The services provided by the check cashing and other services segments are ideal for distribution over the internet and user-friendly technological advances have effectively decreased the need for human capital.

volatility_points.volatility_description: Loan administrators are susceptible to changes in interest rates, which are set by the Federal Reserve in response to economic conditions. Interest rates were set to an all-time low as a result of the COVID-19 pandemic, causing mortgage originations to surge. Rising inflation has caused the Federal Reserve to raise interest rates, reducing economic activity. Uncertainty regarding additional rate hikes and a possible recession has increased the volatility in the industry.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Competition from peer-to-peer money transfer systems
volatility_points.volatility_description: Consumers are continuing to use peer-to-peer money transfer systems that offer more convenience than industry services. The shift in consumer preference to a more convenient and fast process is set to increase over the next five years, increasing volatility in revenue generation.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Loan service providers use technology that accommodates all areas of loan servicing, including loan set up and maintenance, cashiering, escrow administration and investor accounting. Data warehousing and customer management technologies have improved efficiencies in servicing and administering loans. These technological advancements have reduced costs and increased industry efficiency, resulting in increased profit.

Banks are being forced to develop new technology to compete with financial technology companies. Over the past two years, banks have been focusing on improving the ease and timeliness of banking procedures through the development of banking apps for smartphones. The technology greatly reduces banks' day-to-day operating costs. Mobile banking effectively decreases operating costs while replacing revenue from the check cashing and money transmission segments of this industry.

FAQs.question: Does your company specialize in one corner of the market or produce a diversified range of products?
FAQs.answer: Loan servicers work with a variety of loan types of various complexity. One growing segment is the servicing of small business loans, which has become more important as the COVID-19 pandemic leads to heightened demand for the Paycheck Protection Program, administered by industry operators.

FAQs.question: Are your sales heavily dependent on the health of the US economy?
FAQs.answer: The health of the US economy is extremely important to this industry, which relies on per capita disposable income and housing starts. The prime rate influences demand for loan servicing. Demand for loan servicing increases as the prime rate falls. The economic downturn occurring currently due to the coronavirus outbreak has weighed down demand for industry services, although this has been tempered by increased demand for mortgages and government assistance programs.

FAQs.question: Has your company been exposed to volatile prices over the past few years?
FAQs.answer: Volatility in home prices affects the mortgage servicing industry. Volatility in corporate profit affects demand for loan servicing. A fall in corporate profit is expected to weigh down industry revenue, while rising home prices are expected to bolster industry revenue, as the industry contends with conflicting trends due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

FAQs.question: Has your company explored acquisition opportunities in locations with well-established infrastructure networks?
FAQs.answer: Servicers are located increasingly near areas where there is growth in housing markets.

FAQs.question: Have you been able to reduce wage costs by automating operations over the past five years?
FAQs.answer: The loan administration industry has reduced wages costs with the use of new technology. Wages costs are still high for this industry. The rollout of 5G wireless networks is expected to increase the ability for companies to automate financial transactions.

FAQs.question: Does your company use advanced software systems for inventory management and customer records?
FAQs.answer: Technology and data analysts are in increasing demand for the loan administration industry. Technology used for cash handling helps operators compete with money transfer services. Advances in cloud computing and storage technology, along with the rollout of faster 5G wireless networks, are expected to increase the efficiency of industry operations.

FAQs.question: How does your company stay compliant with lending regulations?
FAQs.answer: Increased government regulation on subprime mortgage lending is a threat to industry revenue. New regulation regarding mortgage servicing will affect the industry in the future. The current administration may tighten mortgage servicing and other financial regulations, highlighting the importance for companies to stay compliant with regulations.

FAQs.question: How does your company earn revenue in light of restrictive legislation?
FAQs.answer: Industry operators increase the complexity of their credit offerings. Industry operators target a larger number of customer segments with products to service. Furthermore, assistance programs enacted in response to the COVID-19 pandemic have bolstered revenue for companies in this industry.

FAQs.question: How has price volatility of costs affected profit margins over the past months?
FAQs.answer: The volatility of the market values of mortgage servicing rights and increasing amortization of cash flows affect industry profit margins. Financial markets have experienced increased volatility since the onset of the COVID-19 pandemic, with an initial steep fall in asset prices in March followed by a long period of growth.

FAQs.question: How does your company compensate for the dependence of cash flow on the economy?
FAQs.answer: Industry operators need to build a mortgage servicing portfolio that persists through volatility in the general economy. Operators collect annual or monthly fees on mortgage servicing rights to avoid seasonality of cash flows. Heightened demand for small business assistance loans through the PPP is expected to bolster the industry through a period of decline. An unexpected boost in demand for mortgages for single-family homes has also bolstered industry revenue in a difficult economic environment.

FAQs.question: What is the training process for new hires like? How much prior experience is necessary for workers at your company?
FAQs.answer: Employing experienced staff who specialize in different loan products is a critical element of success.

FAQs.question: How hard is it to promote your services to clients? What are the demographics of your clientele like?
FAQs.answer: Possessing a large network of lenders and loan originators is a key success factor for firms in this industry. This also makes companies in this industry better suited to weather economic shocks, such as the COVID-19 pandemic.

FAQs.question: How quickly can new technology be adopted? Does your company keep up to date with the latest technology?
FAQs.answer: Industry participants must constantly update consumer relations technology to improve business processes and streamline consumer relations. The COVID-19 pandemic has only increased the importance of online customer relations technology to a company's success in this industry.

FAQs.question: What proportion of your revenue is derived from servicing mortgages? What proportion comes from collateralized debt?
FAQs.answer: Increased demand from real estate loans and collateralized debt increases demand for loan administration and servicing. A significant amount of real estate loans comes in the form of mortgages, which also increases mortgage servicing revenue for this industry. Demand for single-family homes rose in the latter part of the 2020, as many individuals sought the increased privacy of single-family homes in the suburbs, raising demand for industry services.

FAQs.question: Do you keep track of the prime rate? Has your company monitored trends in loan demand?
FAQs.answer: The prime rate affects industry revenue by influencing demand for credit, aggregate private investment, mortgages and new residential construction. Demand for mortgages and new residential construction influence the inventory of new housing available, affecting house prices. Lower interest rates, in addition to increased demand for the privacy of single-family homes, has contributed to an unexpected surge in demand for servicing mortgages due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

FAQs.question: How has the performance of property markets affected the performance of your company? How do you fare when prices fall?
FAQs.answer: The performance of property markets affects demand for credit and influences the size of service providers' loan-service portfolios. The housing market has stabilized over the period, characterized by gradually increasing prices and borrowing costs for consumers. House prices climbed in 2020, due to increased demand for single-family homes amid the COVID-19 pandemic.
